[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-15 09:52:25): Hey all, Thursday is a crowded, exciting day so I'm sending this announcement in advance in order to help you plan.

These are all open to everyone in v2 **12-1PM in Coworking**: [Parag Khanna](https://lu.ma/qdrgoebd) is a geopolitics expert and author.

He will join as a guest speaker for an hour. **1-2:30PM in Coworking:** Bill Burnett and Mark Wee are coming from Stanford and will lead an [exercise and lecture](https://lu.ma/ob8jntzc) on how to best design your life. **6:30-7:30PM in 1215 (if weather allows):** We'll do our regularly scheduled Win Forum and disburse more points For those of you in bootcamp, we'll schedule a dinner for later in the week soon.

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-14 12:03:19): @everyone If you're part of the NS Bootcamp, submit this [form](<https://ns.com/bootcamp/day1>) with your overall plan and weekly goals.

We'll meet at [NS Library at 1pm](<https://lu.ma/outo7knw>) tomorrow to start day 1.

Btw the Bootcampers will work out at 7am or 11am üî•

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-14 09:47:42): There will be a [Bootcamp Dinner at 6pm](https://lu.ma/q6a2oijj) in the Ping Pong Room.

The applications were earnest so we accepted everyone who applied.

We'll discuss the rules for the Bootcamp and the next steps to start working towards the 12 week plan.

Grab your dinner and see you all soon!
[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-14 04:03:11): [Holi celebration](https://lu.ma/gjd8g3ue) just started by the pool!

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-13 18:29:44): Happy Pi Day!

Enjoy all the events throughout the morning and early afternoon. [NS Bootcamp applications](https://ns.com/bootcamp) are due at 2PM We'll share more about points at 4:30PM in Coworking during [Win Forum.](https://lu.ma/0ct98ors) There will be [a dinner at 6PM for Bootcamp admits ](https://lu.ma/q6a2oijj)only (everyone is welcome to <@782043129003507722> 's [event in the cafe](https://lu.ma/bcplhm22) right after Win Forum when he launches Dolcevita Italian Grocery üòç)

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-13 10:22:52): Hi @everyone -** we're going to move Win Forum to 4:30pm tomorrow in NS Coworking.** This will coincide with our Pi Day announcement of NS Points, followed shortly by our 6PM Bootcamp dinner for admitted members. <@777003807279677500> will give a talk to share more on points tomorrow during the session.

Enjoy the extra hour of your evenings and be sure to secure a seat for <@143821268842577921> [acoustic concert](https://lu.ma/8rfpd7um) later this evening üé∏ and the [Holi bonfire](https://lu.ma/rjyptn5p) celebration afterwards üî•

[#announcements] donovansung (2025-03-13 05:03:51): @everyone for anyone who is interested in applying for the NS Bootcamp and would like to discuss with us before the application deadline at 2pm tomorrow (Pi Day), I‚Äôll be at the NS Library from 2:30pm onward today, then will walk over to coworking around 3pm for the robotics lecture with Dr.

Shao Lin from NUS!

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-12 14:52:40): **MARCH 12 ‚Äî THE DAILY DOWNLOAD** __Talk by Dr.

Shao Lin from NUS__ ü¶æ @everyone There will be a [lecture by professor Shao Lin](<https://lu.ma/l0z6rfgx>) at 3:30pm tomorrow at Coworking.

He will talk about his work at the intersection of robotics and artificial intelligence.

There may or may not be a surprise robot dog at the talk (depending on whether it can cross customs). __Win Forum__ üèÜ Our first [Win Forum](<https://lu.ma/0ct98ors>) will be at 6:30pm in Room 1215 tomorrow.

Post your wins on Warpcast and submit this [form](<https://ns.com/wins>) to share you wins with the community.

See these examples from [Aviral](<https://warpcast.com/aviral10x/0xafbacd77>), [Romina](<https://warpcast.com/rrominarr/0xf0c38b6e>), [Damian](<https://warpcast.com/drk-eth/0xeee28179>), [Akshay](<https://warpcast.com/akshay/0xc7faeb3d>), and [I](https://warpcast.com/yashluna.eth/0x6c7aa946).

Come find me at NS Cafe at 5pm if you need help setting up your Warpcast account. __Bootcamp Dinner__ üë®‚Äçüíª We will review all applications and share decisions by 5:30pm Friday.

There will be [Bootcamp Dinner](<https://lu.ma/q6a2oijj>) in the Ping Pong Room at 6pm for all Bootcampers.

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-12 13:26:53): The v1 of the NS Makerspace is now available for you to use!

It‚Äôs near the library on the third floor of the south tower.

There‚Äôs a 3D printer and work bench for you to create prototypes.

You‚Äôre welcome to add other tools to the Makerspace.

Regarding the 3D printer: If you‚Äôd like a different color filament (the default one provided is white), you‚Äôre welcome to buy it.

The printer‚Äôs model is a Creality Ender 3 V3 Plus, which is helpful information if you want to teach yourself how to use it.

My recommendation is to use AI to learn how to design 3D asset file formats like .STL or .OBJ There is a USB in the printer where you can drop files from your laptop to print.

Please don‚Äôt waste filament and try to print things that are worthwhile!

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-11 15:32:08): The NS Yoga Studio is open for use (some of you have already had the pleasure of attending sessions led by <@1194521609067831328> , <@1293090438219038735> , and others here).

You're welcome to host meditation sessions as well.

We will add a few plants in the coming week to bring more life to the space.

Additionally, let me know if there is any artwork you would like to add to the walls, and we will review on a rolling basis üôÇ The NS Yoga Studio is located on the 3rd floor near the Library.

You may find it to be a relaxing place to recharge after some work or recover from a Burn.

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-11 14:58:46): @everyone **NS Bootcamp Application is live!** Complete this [application](https://ns.com/bootcamp) by 2pm on March 14 (Pi Day) to apply for NS Bootcamp.

In your response, share why you are uniquely suited to working on the startup idea you've selected.

We understand that finding a co-founder in 72 hours may be difficult so we'll make exceptions for sincere, high quality applications from solo founders.

It's time to build üèóÔ∏è

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-11 07:57:16): @everyone Three quick updates: 1) **Digital Nomad Visa Sessions at 4pm** üõÇ If you are interested in the [Malaysian Digital Nomad Visa](https://mdec.my/derantau/foreign) to stay at Network long-term, <@961189780631212052> will be at NS Cafe at 4pm to walk through the application process and answer any questions. 2) **Book Club at 4:15pm** üìö Come to NS Cafe and find a table based on the [book](https://ns.com/learn) you want to discuss with other members. 3) **Co-founder Mixer at 5pm** ü§ù Complete the form at [ns.com/survey](https://ns.com/survey) to add your profile to this [sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Yw1dhzMM6jvo_bKBI5wlAV7et0TDyVJ8VhXcNBRGcLQ/edit?usp=sharing).

Use the sheet to find potential co-founders and DM them on Discord to meet you at a specific table at NS Cafe.

See you all soon!

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-10 06:19:24):

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-10 06:19:00): @everyone **Network School Bootcamp** Building on the energy from <@875646394558476328>'s session last week, we're kicking off [Network School Bootcamp](https://lu.ma/a15w371b) as part of the Learn track.

This will be a multi-month program for aspiring tech founders and early startup employees.

Participants will work on a project, share weekly updates, and get mentorship during dedicated office hours.

We'll also dive deep into practical insights, founder stories, and tactical knowledge to level yourself up professionally.

The first session kicks off tomorrow at 1:00pm in NS Library.

No filters, no recordings ‚Äî just real, raw conversations about what it takes to build generational companies.

Sign up [here](https://lu.ma/a15w371b) and see you at NS Library.

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-09 17:07:55): Two big events today (Monday) about the future of genomics. *Keep reading for a chance at a free Nucleus Kit ($400 value)* **[Monday Community Lecture (1 PM, Coworking)](https://lu.ma/iht8h8u0)**: The CEO of Nucleus Genomics (Thiel Fellow Kian Sadeghi) is arriving at campus in a few hours to share his thoughts on integrating genetics into healthcare.

Balaji will join him in a Fireside to ask questions you may have about AI gene editing, whole-genome sequencing, and even gene-based dating platforms üëÄ.

Please join us in NS Coworking at 1PM and be prompt.

Only those who are on time (or early) will have a chance to compete for available prizes üëº **[V1 Genetic Results Reveal (9PM):](https://lu.ma/unxshlde)** This is only available for the ~100 v1 members who did a DNA health test.

Nucleus will email your results at 8PM SGT.

We‚Äôll give you an hour to read through them privately and then we will host a global Zoom with the Nucleus team for v1 members at 9PM SGT for anyone who wants to learn more about how to make the most of their data.

It should be really fun!

See @everyone at 1PM for lecture!

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-09 12:18:44): @everyone **Network School ‚Äî Learn & Earn** üë®‚Äçüíª üí∞ Learn and Earn are core pillars of the daily loop we're building at the Network School.

Complete this short form at [ns.com/survey](<https://ns.com/survey>) to share where you are in your career.

So we can structure our curriculum (talks, tutorials, quizzes, reading list, office hours, career counseling, etc) to help you level up in your *learning* and *earning* journeys.

Also a quick burn reminder from <@909952408346566667>: we'll have 7am Burn sessions starting tomorrow. üî•

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-07 08:46:07): @everyone **The first NS Hackathon starts at 12pm tomorrow in the Ping Pong Room** üíª Hackathons used to be reserved for hardcore computer scientists and engineers ‚Äî but not anymore.

The rise of generative AI is changing the game and ushering in the era of the *vibe-coder*. üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è üë®‚Äçüíª ‚ú® It doesn‚Äôt matter if you're a beginner or a cracked 100x engineer ‚Äî tools like Cursor, Replit, Windsurf, and Lovable can help you go from idea to MVP in just a few hours.

Sign up [here](https://lu.ma/auifgm9n) and reach out to <@964457738098843648> <@977970324832387152> for any logistical questions.

The NS Core team will be judging.

And the winning team walks away with [Nucleus DNA tests](https://mynucleus.com/product). üèÜ

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-06 19:40:45): **Friday** - 7a Starship flight watch party (Ping Pong Room) - 7:30a Volleyball practice (coordinates are in the Luma event https://lu.ma/sxdd5hqx) - 9a Join NS on Strava - 10a Daily Mental Reset Aum/Om Chants - 10:30a Himalayan Kriya Yoga (ask <@1293090438219038735> for the event location) - 12p Farcaster Frames Schelling Point (Ping Pong) - 2p D/Acc Cypherpunk Futurism (Ping Pong) - 4p Unlocking China Part 1 of 4 (Coworking) - 5p Junto: History as Trajectory (FULL) - 6p Poker Night (Ping Pong) - 7p Friday Drinks (Talk to <@724673140432699433> for location) - 8:30 Vipassana meditation (Talk to Andy for the location) **Saturday** 12p-6p The first ever hackathon at NS! 7:30p Tarot Reading on the Beach (Side note - let me know if you have a script that can help automate these kinds of messages.

Bonus points if you can build this without needing Discord admin access or oversight from a team member to make it.

Scope would be to scan Lu.ma/ns for the day's events at 11:59pm every night and then send a message with something resembling the above format, ie. [TIME],[EVENT NAME],[LOCATION][LUMA LINK])

In addition to the cash prize from the entry fees, the winner will also get a [Nucleus DNA test](<https://mynucleus.com/product>) worth $399! üß¨ Sign up here: https://lu.ma/qkwng46x.

[#announcements] balajis (2025-03-05 18:16:01):

[#announcements] balajis (2025-03-05 18:15:34): Btw, here are some images of the new [ns.com/profile](https://ns.com/profile) (which gets updated as you complete quizzes) and [ns.com/learn](https://ns.com/learn) (with the book list).

[#announcements] balajis (2025-03-05 18:14:23): @everyone **The Network School Book Club** The Network School Book Club is now live at ns.com/learn!

Here‚Äôs how it works: 1) _Read books at ns.com/learn._ There‚Äôs a weekly list of books at ns.com/learn, all on various aspects of building startup societies, with links to get them on Amazon. 2) _Discuss books on Tuesday afternoon._ Each week, we‚Äôll hold a book club in the NS Cafe right before dinner time on Tuesday from 4-6pm.

The first hour prior to dinner will be silent reading, and the second hour will be live discussion, which you can continue during dinner at 6pm.

We‚Äôll group you for book club as we did for the mixer. 3) _Optionally, quiz and Warpcast review._ Each book has an optional quiz to self-test your understanding and get an NFT for your ns.com/profile.

For extra credit, write a book review (whether full post or tweet length) and post it from your warpcast.com account. **The First Three NS Books** Most books on our list relate to startup societies, but the first week's curriculum is focused on self-improvement: a) _Atomic Habits_ is James Clear‚Äôs guide to programming yourself b) _Navalmanack_ is my friend Naval‚Äôs guide to building wealth c) And _Tools of Titans_ is Tim Ferriss‚Äôs collection of successful heuristics from the successful Why assign these three first?

We're front-loading these three in particular so you can keep going back to them in the weeks/months that follow to keep getting value out of them.

These types of books generate compound interest.

Think of this as the "win" part of "win-and-help-win", the individual self-improvement part that's a daily part of the Network School Curriculum. **Next Steps** OK.

As next steps, all you have to do is: a) get the books on Kindle via [ns.com/learn](https://ns.com/learn) and b) sign up for the first book club from 4-6pm on Tuesday via [lu.ma/61pn7tfw](https://lu.ma/61pn7tfw) We'll assign groups like for the mixer prior to Tuesday at 4pm.

See you then!

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-03-05 09:49:54): **Talk by Network School co-founder Donovan Sung** @everyone Tomorrow at 1:30pm in NS Coworking we'll have a talk by Donovan.

He'll share stories from his time at YouTube (~$400B), Spotify ($100B), and Xiaomi ($200B) working at three hectocorn companies across three continents.

Donovan will be sharing unfiltered insights and personal experiences, so this session will be off-the-record with no photography/videography allowed.

See you at NS Coworking: https://lu.ma/v0cnzbg9.

[#announcements] jacksonofalltrades (2025-03-05 08:37:20): @everyone The NS Content Studio is open for businessüé• üé¨ The studio is located on the 3rd floor of the South Tower.

It‚Äôs equipped with tripods, studio lights, a microphone, acoustic sound panels, high-speed WiFi, and phone tripod adapters.

You can also bring additional personal equipment.

Additionally, I have my own DSLR that you can use if you ask nicely üôÇ You can reserve the content studio for 30 minutes at a time at cal.com/nscontentstudio for up to four consecutive slots (2 hours).

Please do not book the content studio as a phone booth for regular meetings.

Can't wait to see what everyone makes!

For the mixer, we‚Äôve clustered everyone that submitted this [form](<https://forms.ns.com/t/kkWHmxcsBVus>) into [groups](<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1u4Eua9Psk7u8srZ_wBpFa2xkvAbweAjPq8atwBg-K9E/edit?usp=sharing>) of four to discuss your goals at NS. <@764986447253209110> and I will be there to help facilitate.

[#announcements] yashluna (2025-02-22 05:43:18): @everyone please complete the requirements below to ensure smooth travel to the Network School.

Excited to see everyone irl in a week! 1) üì© **NS Onboarding**.

We emailed all confirmed admits an onboarding form link.

Complete this form at the earliest so we can prepare for your arrival. 2) üöå **Group Transport**.

Complete this [poll](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1278081815139188817/1339949766552850584) if you plan to join the group transport from Changi Airport to Network School on March 1 at 12pm.

You must submit the onboarding form to be able to check-in to the bus. 3) üá∏üá¨ **Singapore Arrival Card**.

If you are transiting via Singapore, complete the [Singapore Digital Arrival Card](https://eservices.ica.gov.sg/sgarrivalcard/) within 3 days of your planned entry into Singapore.

You must also ensure that you meet the [entry requirements](https://www.passportindex.org/country/singapore/) and have a Singapore visa if necessary based on your passport. 4) üá≤üáæ **Malaysia Arrival Card**.

All members must complete the [Malaysia Digital Arrival Card](https://imigresen-online.imi.gov.my/mdac/main) within 3 days of your planned entry into Malaysia.

You must also ensure that you meet the [entry requirements](https://www.passportindex.org/country/malaysia/) and have a Malaysia visa if necessary based on your passport.

Note: 99% of the world can enter Malaysia visa-free but everyone is still required to submit the arrival card. 5) üìú **Additional Documents**.

Check with online resources and your local Malaysian embassy If you require additional documents to enter Malaysia.

Some nationalities may require hotel booking and/or invitation letter.

Respond in this [thread](https://discord.com/channels/900827411917201418/1279113199509180447/1279113200662610018) if you need these documents. 6) üé´ **Return Tickets**.

We recommend having a copy of your return tickets handy.

Malaysian Immigration asks for return tickets and additional documents only some times (depending on the port of entry and the officer) but you may be denied entry if you can't provide them.

Some websites and airlines that allow booking fully refundable tickets if you want to keep your travel plans flexible. 7) üõÇ **Digital Nomad Visa**.

If you're planning to stay at the Network School long term, learn about the Malaysia Digital Nomad Visa and start your application soon because it may take up to 8 weeks to hear back.

More information in the [Network School Wiki](https://ns.com/wiki).

Finally, as you get ready for the Network School, turn on notifications for ‚Å†the <#1284425829387862087> channel to stay in the loop üîî And as always, DM me <@1045750584344584282> or <@764986447253209110> if you have any private questions.

I‚Äôm not a tech person by nature ‚Äî I‚Äôm more interested in how technology and society influence each other.

Back then, we used Bitcoin as money to trade veggies, land, labor, etc.

No one thought of it as ‚ÄúHODL never spend digital gold.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Bootstrapped Hungary‚Äôs crypto ecosystem‚Äî[founded the first exchange/brokerage](https://mrcoin.eu) (since exited), launched ATMs (with a highly ranked central bank officer [praising Bitcoin at the inaugural event](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sDvEgqsbZow)üòÖ), organized educational workshops, meetups, etc.

Fun fact: We have the longest-running [Bitcoin Meetup](http://www.bitcoinbudapest.hu) in the world!

‚Ä¢ Erected the first [Satoshi Statue](https://www.youtube.com/live/em74TdeSsbw?t=2363s) in Budapest, which became a pilgrimage site for crypto enthusiasts (and is now the default ‚ÄúSatoshi image‚Äù in the press).

‚Ä¢ Built a small GPU rig to learn about mining‚Äîand it ended up mining Ethereum‚Äôs [genesis block](https://x.com/keo/status/1272844823834308608).

‚Ä¢ Helped fund and bootstrap a pirate microschool/homeschooling club for my son 10 years ago because we couldn‚Äôt find any alternatives we were happy with.

Excited to be here and looking forward to connecting.

I‚Äôm Ursula O‚ÄôKuinghttons, and my journey has always been about stories, whether it‚Äôs interviewing migrants searching for a new home or Heads of State shaping the future.

I started in journalism at Prisa Media (Spain), covering major global events and expanding media across Europe, Spain and Latin America.

But in 2012, I became fascinated by the idea that technology, specifically blockchain, could rebuild the media industry, making it more transparent, independent, and resilient.

That curiosity led me to ConsenSys, where I was a founding member of Civil, one of the first attempts to decentralize journalism.

Later, as Director of Communications and Partnerships at the Web3 Foundation in Switzerland, I helped to launchPolkadot.

Now, as CMO of Scytale Digital VC and an advisor to Project Liberty (Frequency blockchain), I‚Äôm focused on building bridges between technology, media, and business.

Project Liberty recently made a bid to acquire TikTok in the US with the goal of decentralizing it.

We shall see how that unfolds, but the ambition is clear: put control back into the hands of users.

A few exciting things ahead: I‚Äôm organizing Decentralize Lugano, a finance-focused event in Switzerland, in May 8th, and I‚Äôll also be at ETH Denver, where we‚Äôre hosting Frequency House, and Merge Buenos Aires, where I‚Äôll be presenting a Web3 documentary on FC Barcelona, a project I‚Äôm proud to be part of.

I‚Äùll be joining the NS In August, I‚Äôll be moving to Singapore with my 12-year-old son, and we‚Äôre both looking forward to this new chapter.

As they scale, they will increase capacity.

The best way to get accepted is to start contributing early & voluntarily, not just to attend but to build something that you also believe in.

That'll almost guarantee a spot and also lead to making new friends before you even go there.

Good luck!

[#reception] odysseus0z (2024-08-26 07:20:19): Hey everyone, George here.

I discovered Balaji's 1729 community after leaving big tech out of boredom, and it's been life-changing.

Since then, I've been deep in crypto, currently working at Flashbots, where we solve MEV problems and build Ethereum infrastructure like MEV-Boost.

We're also exploring hardware-based solutions like TEE for credible and confidential computing (same tech used for Apple Intelligence).

On the side, I invest in and advise startups and funds in the space.

My Network School goal is to step back and refocus on the big questions.

I'm at a "mid-life crisis" point as a crypto builder, seeing how much of the space has drifted from the original crypto spirit.

Some key concerns I have include: 1.

Centralization Creep: Growing influence of institutional players (e.g., ETFs) potentially centralizing power and increasing vulnerability to attacks. 2.

Speculative Casino Culture: Influx of opportunists and scammers across all levels, turning the industry into a speculative playground‚Äîwhere the yield/return comes from. 3.

Self-Regulation Failure: Industry's struggle to self-regulate and prevent bad actors from hijacking the movement, exposing limitations of libertarian ideals. 4.

Hype Over Substance: Prevalence of shallow, overhyped projects optimized for impressing retails and quick exits rather than creating real impact or sustainable business/protocol, fostering a culture of pseudo-profound but ultimately meaningless innovations.

Balaji's clear big-picture thinking was what I loved most about

1729. (I often joke he's our era's Hari Seldon, while I'm still the clueless encyclopedist ‚Äì Foundation fans will get it.) I'm here to: 1.

Find my own answers to the big questions about crypto as an industry and movement 2.

Get a clearer picture of our current world 3.

Gain more clarity and conviction for my future path Excited to embark on this journey with you all ‚Äì can't wait to learn from you, have fun, and tackle these challenges together!
